{{European national under-19 football team | Name = Italy Under-19 | Badge = | Badgesize = 125 px | Nickname = | Association = ''[[Italian Football Federation|''Federazione Italiana
Giuoco Calcio]]'' | Coach = {{flagicon|Italy}} [[Alberigo Evani]] | Captain = | Most caps = | Top scorer = | |pattern_la1= _ITA10h |pattern_b1= _ITA10h |pattern_ra1=_ITA10h |pattern_sh1=_ITA10a |pattern_so1=_thinwhitesides |leftarm1=0066bc |body1=000000 |rightarm1=0066bc |shorts1=0066bc |socks1=003cc3 |pattern_la2= _ITA10a |pattern_b2= _ITA10a |pattern_ra2= _ITA10a |pattern_so2= _thinsidesonwhite |pattern_sh2= _ITA10h |leftarm2=FFFFFF |body2=FFFFFF |rightarm2=FFFFFF |shorts2=0066bc |socks2=003cc3 |- UEFAu19Champ apps = 25 | UEFAu19Champ first = [[1981 UEFA European Under-18 Football Championship|1981]] | UEFAu21Champ best = Winners: [[2003 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2003]]| }} The '''Italy national under-19 football team''' is the national under-19 [[Association football|football]] team of [[Italy]] and is controlled by the [[Italian Football Federation]]. The team competes in the [[UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship]], held every year. == UEFA U-18 Championship Record == Before 2002, the event was classified as a U-18 tournament. * 1981: Second Round * 1982: Qualifying Round * 1983: Semi-finalists * 1984: Second Round * 1986: Runner-up * 1988: Qualifying Round * 1990: Qualifying Round * 1992: Qualifying Round * 1993: Intermediary Round * 1994: Intermediary Round * 1995: Runner-up * 1996: 4th in Group B * 1997: Preliminary Round * 1998: Preliminary Round * 1999: Runner-up * [[2000 UEFA European Under-18 Football Championship|2000]]: Intermediary Round * [[2001 UEFA European Under-18 Football Championship|2001]]: Preliminary Round == UEFA U-19 Championship Record == * [[2002 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2002]]: ''Preliminary Round'' * [[2003 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2003]]: '''Winner''' * [[2004 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2004]]: 3rd in group stage A * [[2005 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2005]]: ''Elite Round'' * [[2006 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2006]]: ''Qualifying Round'' * [[2007 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2007]]: ''Elite Round'' * [[2008 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2008]]: Runner-up * [[2009 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2009]]: ''Qualifying Round'' * [[2010 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2010]]: 4th in group stage B * [[2011 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2011]]: ''Elite Round'' ==Coaches== *1992â2006: [[Paolo
